intro: Thelypodium leptosepalum, commonly known as the slender-sepal thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Thelypodium leptosepalum is often found in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
